attributes.action: Review the education budgets and support for the arts provided by the Welsh Assembly Government
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This year the Welsh Assembly Governement have reduced the budget allowance for Greenhill School in Tenby by 7.5%. Consequently this has a significant impact upon the school's ability to maintain their music & drama commitments.
The school orchestra is Nationally recognised with a number of talented musicians in their ranks.
With students from Greenhill, making up 50% of the County Orchestras in Pembrokeshire, the budget cuts have wide reaching impacts, which will effectively reduce the performance and commpetetive abilities of students. In addition key staff will be lost at County level, due to lack of finacial support, impacting on all schools in the area.
